clinical_study.brief_title: Is There a Desensitization During Sleep After Exposure to a Violent Verbal Input ?
clinical_study.official_title: Y a T-il Une désensibilisation Pendant le Sommeil après la réception de Violence Verbale ?

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, France

collaborator.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.source: Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, France

brief_summary.textblock: There is a need for quantify the emotional and neurophysiological perception of verbal violence, in order to understand the impact it might have on a subject. This project aims at assessing the influence of time, sleep, and people interaction on the perception of verbal violence.

detailed_description.textblock: There are many processes involved in the perception of verbal violence. There is a need for quantified data to have a better understanding the physiological and neurological perception of verbal violence, in order to understand the impact it might have on a subject. This project aims at assessing the influence of time, sleep, and people interaction on the perception of verbal violence. The "cognitive replay" will also be assessed through dreams. The investigators think that sleep plays a role in desensitization to negative emotions and to memory consolidation. However, the role of sleep in verbal violence remains unknown.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Watching two different videos (one violent, one non-violent), re-exposure after 11h daytime (wake period) or 11h nighttime (sleep period). The order of videos is balanced, in a cross over fashion
study_design_info.masking_description: The analysis of heart signal, polysomnography and dream reports analysis will be performed by assessors masked to the group and type of video.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During each video exposure (duration 1.2 min), 4 times
primary_outcome.description: heart rate in beat per min

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the video exposure (duration 1.2 min), 4 times
secondary_outcome.description: measure of electrodermal reaction, in millivolts

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the video exposure (duration 1.2 min), 4 times
secondary_outcome.description: measure of the pulse wave, in millivolts

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Just after the video exposure, during 1 min

arm_group.description: Watching a video containing verbal and visual violence in the evening, and again in the next morning
Watching a video containing verbal and visual non-violence in the morning, and then again the evening of the same day

intervention.description: Video -clip 1 contains violent images and text
Video -clip 2 contains neutral images and text

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject fully understands French
- Subject willing to consent to the study and signed the written consent
- Subject is afiliated to the Freanch national health care system (Sécurité Sociale)
- Subject level of education superior to "Brevet des collèges" (an equivalent would be the general certificate of secondary education)
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject is not able to understand the protocol
- The subject has a language disorder
- The subject has a psychiatric or neurological disorders
- The subject does not use psychotropic drugs
- The subject has watched the advertidement : "stop djihadisme", broadcasted on television by the french government
